1.text: Remember, O Jehovah, what hath befallen us, Look attentively, and see our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance hath been turned to strangers, Our houses to foreigners.

3.text: Orphans we have been—without a father, our mothers are as widows.

4.text: Our water for money we have drunk, Our wood for a price doth come.

5.text: For our neck we have been pursued, We have laboured—there hath been no rest for us.

6.text: To Egypt we have given a hand, To Asshur, to be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers have sinned—they are not, We their iniquities have borne.

8.text: Servants have ruled over us, A deliverer there is none from their hand.

9.text: With our lives we bring in our bread, Because of the sword of the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin as an oven hath been burning, Because of the raging of the famine.

11.text: Wives in Zion they have humbled, Virgins—in cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes by their hand have been hanged, The faces of elders have not been honoured.

13.text: Young men to grind they have taken, And youths with wood have stumbled.

14.text: The aged from the gate have ceased, Young men from their song.

15.text: Ceased hath the joy of our heart, Turned to mourning hath been our dancing.

16.text: Fallen hath the crown from our head, Woe is now to us, for we have sinned.

17.text: For this hath our heart been sick, For these have our eyes been dim.

18.text: For the mount of Zion—that is desolate, Foxes have gone up on it.

19.text: Thou, O Jehovah, to the age remainest, Thy throne to generation and generation.

20.text: Why for ever dost Thou forget us? Thou forsakest us for length of days!

21.text: Turn us back, O Jehovah, unto Thee, And we turn back, renew our days as of old.

22.text: For hast Thou utterly rejected us? Thou hast been wroth against us—exceedingly?
